smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function getAspectRatio appears to be too complex.
The function setupOrientationEventListener appears to be too complex.
The function setupCameraOutputs appears to be too complex.
The function chooseOptimalPreviewSize appears to be too complex.
The function createCameraPreviewSession appears to be too complex.
The function process appears to be too complex.
The function captureStillPicture appears to be too complex.
The function doInBackground appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'MySize' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MainActivity' with '52' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'SettingsActivity' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'CameraPreview' with '54' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Interface 'MyPreview' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class MainActivity is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class CameraPreview is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: ComplexCondition
smells.description: Complex conditions should be simplified and extracted into well-named methods if necessary.

instances.message: This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.
This condition is too complex.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function chooseOptimalPreviewSize has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function chooseOptimalPreviewSize is nested too deeply.
Function doInBackground is nested too deeply.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface MyPreview is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: UnconditionalJumpStatementInLoop
smells.description: An unconditional jump statement in a loop is useless. The loop itself is only executed once.

instances.message: This loop contains an unconditional jump expression which essentially renders it useless as it will exit the loop during the first iteration.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (size.width * size.height.toFloat()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: size.width * size.height.toFloat()
Parentheses in (mUseFrontCamera && facing == CameraCharacteristics.LENS_FACING_BACK) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: mUseFrontCamera && facing == CameraCharacteristics.LENS_FACING_BACK
Parentheses in (!mUseFrontCamera && facing == CameraCharacteristics.LENS_FACING_FRONT) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: !mUseFrontCamera && facing == CameraCharacteristics.LENS_FACING_FRONT
Parentheses in (diff == currRangeSize && range.lower > currMinRange) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: diff == currRangeSize && range.lower > currMinRange

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.simplemobiletools.camera.helpers.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.simplemobiletools.commons.extensions.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: LoopWithTooManyJumpStatements
smells.description: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

instances.message: The loop contains more than one break or continue statement. The code should be refactored to increase readability.

smells.name: ReturnCount
smells.description: Restrict the number of return statements in methods.

instances.message: Function doInBackground has 6 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.
Function rotate has 3 return statements which exceeds the limit of 2.

smells.name: ForbiddenVoid
smells.description: `Unit` should be used instead of `Void`.

instances.message: 'Void' should be replaced with 'Unit'.
